newsitem.title: INDIA: India's Rabri Devi moves confidence vote.
newsitem.headline: India's Rabri Devi moves confidence vote.

text.p: The chief minister of the eastern Indian state of Bihar, Rabri Devi, on Monday moved a motion of confidence in her government three days after taking over from her husband, Laloo Prasad Yadav.
The Press Trust of India said the speaker of Bihar's state assembly had asked lawmakers to begin debating the motion.
Yadav resigned on Friday after a court in Patna, Bihar's capital, ordered his arrest for involvement in a $280 million embezzlement scandal. India's Supreme Court later overruled the judgement.
Yadav, who says he is innocent in the scandal, won a vote of confidence in his state government on July 15. News reports said Rabri Devi was likely to easily win Friday's vote.
